titleStmt.title: A just complaint of the oppressed, because convicted, fined & distrained excessively, unsummon'd & unheard in their own defence upon clandestine evidence of concealed informers, in their prosecution of the peaceable people called Quakers for their religious meetings, examined by the law of God and nations on pregnant instances : humbly presented to the serious consideration of justices and jurors.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
